item.title: Israel Launches a New Offensive in Gaza
item.description: The two month ceasefire in Gaza has come to an end with Israel conducting airstrikes, killing five Hamas officials along with over 400 others, including many children. The Israeli military has also restarted ground operations in Gaza, sending troops back to areas they had withdrawn from. They say they want Hamas to agree to a new ceasefire deal and release more hostages. But many Israelis are opposed to this return to war. We hear what this resumption of fighting sounds like in Gaza from our producer there. Warning, this episode contains graphic descriptions of war.

item.title: As U.S. foreign aid programs grind to a halt, African health leaders look for a silver lining

item.title: The Fed holds interest rates steady as Trump's trade agenda sparks uncertainty
item.description: The Fed held rates steady, but left the door open to cut them later this year if inflation continues to ease. Trump's tariffs, however, could complicate efforts to bring prices under control.

item.title: Patients scramble as cheaper obesity drug alternatives disappear
item.description: Compounding pharmacies have been allowed to essentially make a cheaper version of Eli Lilly's Zepbound, but they have to stop Wednesday. That has left many patients wondering what to do next.
